title.narrative: 6.2 STRENGTHENED CAPACITY TO DELIVER ANEXPANDED AND IMPROVED CHILD-SENSITIVE SOC

description.narrative: 6.2 By 2022 strengthened capacity of national and local government to deliver an expanded and improved child-sensitive social protection system., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. By 2022, children benefit from strengthened policies and programmes that address child poverty, vulnerability and exclusion.

Strengthening integrated administrative systems (such as beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, payments)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.2 By 2022 strengthened capacity of national and local government to deliver an expanded and improved child-sensitive socialprotection system.

description.narrative: Inclusive, child sensitive and shock responsive social protection remained a top priority for 2021.; Aided by persistent evidence-based advocacy of UNICEF, WB, FCDO, EU and other development partners, government decided to provide cash relief to 500,000 vulnerable families.;; Based on shock responsive social protection approaches, implemented through the government, UNICEF supported the Nepal provided NPR 10,000 to 9500 Dalit plus families and to Persons with Disability (PWDs) to address the secondary impact of COVID-19 along with supporting the; expansion of Child Grant despite the COVID induced financial crunch. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
